label: PMNS Theta23 Atmospheric
mathematical_goal: Derive the atmospheric mixing angle θ₂₃ = 46.08° from tribimaximal base (45°) plus topological corrections, comparing to NuFIT 6.0 NO (49.0° ± 1.3°)
theoretical_significance: θ₂₃ governs μ ↔ τ neutrino oscillations observed in atmospheric neutrinos. The tribimaximal value θ₂₃ = 45° (maximal mixing) emerges from A₄ tetrahedral symmetry in G₂ ~ Aut(O). The deviation δθ₂₃ ≈ +1° comes from: (1) Betti number asymmetry (b₂ - N_gen) breaking exact A₄ symmetry, and (2) orientation corrections from K=4 matching fibres. The PM prediction θ₂₃ ≈ 46° is in tension with NuFIT 6.0 (49° ± 1.3°) at ~2σ level. This could indicate: (a) higher-order geometric corrections, (b) need for running effects, or (c) the true value is lower than current best fit (allowed at 2σ). Super-Kamiokande and NOvA favor θ₂₃ closer to 45°.

experimental_comparison.note: Some experiments (SK, NOvA) prefer lower values closer to PM

geometry.physical_interpretation: Slight deviation from maximal μ-τ mixing

derivation_chain: A₄ tetrahedral symmetry from G₂ ~ Aut(O) → θ₂₃ = 45° (tribimaximal)
